benchmark_details.name: Hijacking JARVIS: Benchmarking Mobile GUI Agents against Unprivileged Third Parties
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a systematic investigation into the vulnerabilities of mobile GUI agents through a benchmark suite that evaluates their robustness against misleading content injected by unprivileged third parties. It introduces AgentHazard, a framework for simulating attack scenarios, and develops a comprehensive suite comprising a dynamic task execution environment and a static dataset.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically study the vulnerabilities of mobile GUI agents against misleading content attacks and to improve their robustness.

data.source: Constructed from 210 screenshots of 14 popular commercial applications.
data.size: 840 unique tasks and over 3,000 attack scenarios
data.annotation: Manual crafting by human annotators based on selected screenshots.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on the percentage of successful task completion versus misleading agent behavior.
methodology.interpretation: A lower SR indicates greater vulnerability to misleading content.
methodology.baseline_results: Varied across agents; UGround exhibited strongest performance with 48.3% baseline SR.
methodology.validation: Tests conducted on 7 mobile GUI agents and various backbone LLMs.

harm: User data loss due to misleading instructions
